ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about objectives and given circumstances which is very helpful in improving ones acting skills and creative vision.
I learned how to act. This class taught me how to approach monologues, craft a scene, build a character, and all the things you need to know in order to act.
Lots of knowledge about the history of acting, and also specific tools we can use to improve our acting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: this course is fun and you want to do it. I look forward to this class every week. While it is scary to get up in front of people and perform, it is so worth it because everyone has a great time. Not really a weakness because this is just the nature of things but there is a decent amount of work required outside of class, mainly rehearsing. Readings are easy and straightforward.

Strengths: Enthusiasm of instructor, clear progression of ideas/themes studied 
Weaknesses: Lack of warning before major assignments, unclear prompts for major assignments

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Hal is such a great professor, I can not praise him enough! Its a fun and challenging class where you'll get to know other creative students and you all get to explore your creative interests. You get a lot of freedom in choosing what you want to work on which is also nice.

Yes I would. If you want to act or have fun this class is the class to do it. I was always laughing sometimes with other people and sometimes at myself. Everyone in class had a great time and we loved it. Most of them are not theater major or actors.
For theater majors and people who want to improve their acting. This class is not for people who dont want to put in the work.
